intro: Mirbelia pungens, commonly known as the prickly mirbelia, is a shrub native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has a woody stem with a rough, bark-like texture. Its flowers are typically small and appear in late winter to early spring. Mirbelia pungens is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
